reviews.text: As the title of my review says.. i can't fault it- and i'm very fussy! Everything was spot on. The bed was huge and comfy, there was plenty of hot water, everywhere was spotless. staff were attentive and friendly, breakfasts were substantial, with a wide range of food and drink to chose from. the pool/jacuzzi was a real treat. Parking straight outside, although this was £10 a day/night. Still very convenient though in a city centre location.

reviews.text: The hotel is situated at the 'top' end of Broad Street which, if you're not familiar with Birmingham, is generally regarded as the main bar & club 'strip' of the city centre. I'm sure that, in its hey-day, it was even busier than it was recently, but it looks like the economic downturn has put paid to many of those establishments. In fact, there are more closed than open at the top end, but there's still a wide choice to suit all tastes further along.
reviews.title: Lovely - My favourite Birmingham hotel
Great weekend Hotel
reviews.text: You can walk to the centre of the city in about 20 minutes (depending on your speed and mobility of course) and the further in you go the better it looks. It's a very busy city centre and a good choice for shop-a-holics. If you're not too proud, you can hop on a 136 bus from the bottom end of the market and 10-15 minutes later you'll be jumping off just outside the hotel.

I stayed for a few nights at the weekend rate which included breakfast and it still cost 108 pounds a night. This is far more expensive than similar hotels (and you have to pay 15 pounds for cabled internet, when most hotels have free wireless) and the location is on the five ways roundabout which is a shabby area and not very close to any nice restaurants. As such, I ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and found the steak way overcooked the sauce runny and everything else to be barely edible. The staff was incredibly nice and the rooms are to a good standard and quiet, but they need to get a new chef and make sure they don't miss small details (like failing to take the breakfast room service cards from the doors, or bringing coffee cups with the breakfast tray, etc.) to justify the expensive cost of this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice staff but not good value

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed at the Marriott Hotel in Birmingham and to start with I was unsure whether I had made the right choice after reading some of the reviews. From the outside the building looks dated and we were a bit unsure what to expect when we got inside. We were amazed once we entered the hotel, it was incredible!! The hotel is absolutely beautiful! I booked our stay via the internet (which was not the best idea) as I booked a twin room on the advanced purchase ticket. I then received an email to say that they did not have any twim rooms available only doubles and that I could not get a refund. I did send them an email to complain about this and they kindly upgraded us to a suite. It was huge, the bed was a twin king size and the bathroom was massive! I couldn't say a bad word at all about the room it was so luxurious! The best hotel I have ever stayed in and we only paid £65 per night. The location is not right in the centre but only 5 mins walk away from bars and restaurants etc. The bull ring is fantastic for shopping but does get very busy on the weekend. We walked there and it took us about 30 mins. The nightlife is buzzing too, we ended up in Flairs and had a fantastic night. So yes, I would definately book this hotel again!!!!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!!

reviews.text: It did not get off to a good start. Payment for my room had been arranged in advance but there was no record of this. I suggested that their records be checked but in the meantime had to secure the booking with my own card. About 20 minutes after getting to my room it was confirmed that the appropriate notification had been received but not put on the system. The price that was charged was £158.00, an absolutely absurd price for what was a very ordinary room with basic facilities (half this price would have been more realistic - just). As for the room it was as I say basic, pretty ordinary. For that price you at least expect a trouser press, a biscuit or two with the tea and coffee stuff and bath gel which does not smell like something that you would clean the toilet with. Pretty old tv with very limited choice of television and radio channels.
reviews.title: Overpriced mediocrity

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, as most Marriotts are pretty nice. Not a lot of charm for a romantic visit but a great place for a business traveler. We had a clean and spacious room. The room service was fast but the food wasn't great (don't get the pizza). Restaurant/bar looked very nice though we didn't eat there.
reviews.title: Clean, well located, good service
I didn't want to leave
reviews.text: Not terribly far from the downtown Birmingham area, an easy walk. Definitely not a bad spot for a couple of nights in Birmingham, especially if you can use your Marriott points.

We stayed here to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We booked the Romance package which included Champagne and Chocolates plus dinner and breakfast. We were allowed to check in 2 hours before the stated time and the room was beautiful (shame about the view out of the window!). The food in the restuarant was excellent and we couldnt believe the £7 (on average) starters and the £20 (on average mains) were included in our deal. Breakfast waas buffet style and was lovely with a large choice and if it wasnt on display (like porridge) you could request it. The staff really made this hotel. They couldnt do enough for us and were so welcoming and friendly throughout the stay. We were a 15 minute walk to the Aquarium and 5 minutes from a really nice Casino where we ended up and came out £25 better off! Also along this strip are a few lively bars and Gatecrasher Nightclub. The leisure facilites were excellent and everything is so clean. I want to go back asap.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.text: Overall, we are very happy with the Marriott. We had a spacious corner room with a very large bathroom. Bathrobes, slippers and nice hairdryer in room. Comfortable bed. Safe in the room. One bottle of sparkling water by bedside. Employees are very helpful and nice. Possible downsides: we had to ask for luggage racks, but they were delivered promptly. Not a lot of drawer/closet space. Instant coffee/tea service in room (better than nothing.) Restaurant is not open during the week, only on weekends, but food is available all day in the bar-lounge area. Cocktails are expensive and as in most of Europe, you get a small pour. Overall, our experience has been positive and we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Everything it should be - i.e. excellent!

reviews.text: This was a really great hotel. The service was friendly, warm and professional. Passing through the lobby, it was nice to be greeted by staff in the lovely, wood paneled reception area.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Service
